Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2014 09:59AM Slappy-Squirrel wrote: Spoomsister, I found your post while trying to find out what could cause the dimple/skin tethering I noticed on my right  breast when I raised my arms. I am trying to find out all the info I can on what causes this. I had an ultrasound which showed nothing. I had had a mammogram 2 months before finding the dimple, and elected to not repeat it because they are very painful for me. I've had this skin tethering or dimple for 3 months now and keep telling myself it must be nothing but I'm still worried. It feels like something is pulling deep in my breast. Should I get more testing? FYI, I am 54 years old, my mother and grandmother both died from breast cancer, and my mother's youngest sister is a breast cancer survivor. I have had one biopsy on left breast that turned out to be a fibroid when I was in my  mid 30's.

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2014 08:03AM Slappy-Squirrel wrote: Ann, Thanks for the mammogram info. I am learning a lot here. I'm just not sure what to do now. As for my nickname, not a really interesting story. Ive been nicknamed Squirrel for most of my married life, (OLD song, "Hey Shirley, this is Squirrely). Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2014 10:12AM Slappy-Squirrel wrote: Mayanne, I expect my panel to be negative also. But with the heavy family history, I agree with you; there must be some genetic component they haven't figured out yet. My MRI showed that the cancer is confined to the breast. But it's bigger than originally thought. over an inch (2.9CM) not a little over a half inch. 2 satellite lesions were also found making a lumpectomy harder to do. I see a plastic surgeon next week to talk about reconstruction possibilities. And there was apparently a malfunction that made my other breast light up like a Christmas tree, but they are assuming it's just the malfunction. I'm gonna try to get the MRI redone at no cost to me since it's their machine's screwup. Wish me luck! PS, How did your radiation treatment go? Any side effects? Shirley

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2014 01:39PM Slappy-Squirrel wrote: Well I found out my breast are of "moderate density". Being my age of 54 I couldn't believe that. No nipple retraction or skin thickening can be identified. (Odd, I had needle core biopsy of the left breast many years ago and the fibroid is still there.) ACR Category: 1 "negative" All this sounds pretty good but I'm still worried about this tethering/dimple in my right breast.
